content: Created `pyproject.toml` defining the project metadata, core dependencies (numpy/matplotlib), dev test dependency (pytest), and pytest configuration to run tests against the `src` layout in CI.

output.code:
from pathlib import Path
import json

target_path = Path('/mnt/data').joinpath('pyproject.toml')
target_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

chunks = [
"""[build-system]
requires = ["setuptools>=68", "wheel"]
build-backend = "setuptools.build_meta"

[project]
name = "generated_script_1766539775726"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Seeded toy experiment that generates deterministic JSON + PNG artifacts for CI reproducibility checks."
readme = ""
requires-python = ">=3.9"
license = {text = "MIT"}
authors = [{name = "OpenAI", email = "noreply@example.com"}]
dependencies = [
  "numpy>=1.22",
  "matplotlib>=3.6",
]

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
  "pytest>=7.0",
]

[tool.setuptools]
package-dir = {"" = "src"}
py-modules = ["goal_33_toy_experiment"]

[tool.pytest.ini_options]
minversion = "7.0"
testpaths = ["tests"]
pythonpath = ["src"]
addopts = "-q"
"""
]

final_text = '\n'.join(block.strip('\n') for block in chunks).strip() + '\n'
target_path.write_text(final_text, encoding='utf-8')

print('FILE_WRITTEN:pyproject.toml')
print('DIR_STATE:' + json.dumps(sorted(str(p.relative_to(Path("/mnt/data"))) for p in target_path.parent.glob('*') if p.is_file())))

content.text: Created `pyproject.toml` defining the project metadata, core dependencies (numpy/matplotlib), dev test dependency (pytest), and pytest configuration to run tests against the `src` layout in CI.
